intro: Weinmannia tannaensis, commonly known as Tanna weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tanna in Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypresses and related coniferous trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
